intro: Epithema tenerum, commonly known as the soft epilobe, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it blooms in the spring. Epithema tenerum is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife.
